intro: Galium mycrosphyllum, commonly known as small-fruited bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain several seeds. Galium mycrosphyllum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
